DOC.brief_summary: The exposure of human beings to markedly altered environments (ambient pressure and inhaled gas mixtures) has profound effects on their innate immune capacity to effectively combat viral illnesses. This Phase IIA clinical trial examines the effects of an exposure to a 4 atmospheric environment has on HIV-infected humans whose clinical condition has progressed to formal AIDS status.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Repeated Exposures to Compressed Air on Patients With AIDS
DOC.criteria: CD4 count <200 Viral load > 5000 Opportunistic infection Concurrent neoplasm (see protocol) Immunomodulators HIV vaccination Investigational HIV drugs (see protocol) Pregnant women Major organ transplant
